TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CalendarContract/CalendarAlerts extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Fields and helpers for accessing calendar alerts information.

remarks.para: Fields and helpers for accessing calendar alerts information. These fields are for tracking which alerts have been fired. Scheduled alarms will generate an intent using . Apps that receive this action may update the for the reminder when they have finished handling it. Apps that have their notifications disabled should not modify the table to ensure that they do not conflict with another app that is generating a notification. In general, apps should not need to write to this table directly except to update the state of a reminder.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Net.Uri ContentUri { get; set; }

Docs.summary: The Uri for querying calendar alert information

remarks.para: The Uri for querying calendar alert information

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Net.Uri ContentUriByInstance { get; set; }

Docs.summary: This URI is for grouping the query results by event_id and begin time.

remarks.para: This URI is for grouping the query results by event_id and begin time. This will return one result per instance of an event. So events with multiple alarms will appear just once, but multiple instances of a repeating event will show up multiple times.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
